Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is grey in section, the interior is slightly grooved and covered with a brown resinous deposit, the exterior (now worn) is covered with a red-brown slip and bears faint traces of at least four lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393281) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393281)
